metadata.name: github
metadata.description: Manage GitHub issues and pull requests

functions.description: Add a comment to the target issue.
functions.name: add_issue_comment

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

body.description: Body of the comment in markdown format

functions.description: Add a comment to the target pull request.
functions.name: add_pull_request_comment

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

body.description: Body of the comment in markdown format

functions.description: Create an issue under the given repository.
functions.name: create_issue

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

body.description: Body of the issue in markdown format

labels.description: List of labels to add to the issue

assignees.description: List of users to assign to the issue

functions.description: Create a pull request under the given repository.
functions.name: create_pull_request

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

base.description: Base branch of the pull request, i.e., the branch to merge the pull request into

head.description: Head branch of the pull request, i.e., the branch with your changes

is_draft.description: Whether the pull request is a draft or not

labels.description: List of labels to add to the pull request

assignees.description: List of users to assign to the pull request

functions.description: Edit an existing issue. You can also close or reopen an issue by specifying the state parameter.
functions.name: edit_issue

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

body.description: Body of the issue in markdown format

labels.description: List of labels to add to the issue

assignees.description: List of users to assign to the issue

state.description: Whether the issue is open or closed

functions.description: Edit an existing pull request. You can also close or reopen a pull request by specifying the state parameter.
functions.name: edit_pull_request

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

body.description: Body of the pull request in markdown format

base.description: Base branch of the pull request, i.e., the branch with your changes

labels.description: List of labels to add to the pull request

assignees.description: List of users to assign to the pull request

state.description: Whether the pull request is open or closed

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

functions.description: Get an issue from the given repository.
functions.name: get_issue

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

functions.description: Get a pull request from the given repository.
functions.name: get_pull_request

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

functions.description: Search for issues or pull requests on GitHub.
functions.name: search_issue_pr

query.description:
Search query to search for GitHub issues and pull requests. Below are some query examples:
1. Search for all issues containing "performance" in the repository npi/npi: `is:issue repo:npi/npi performance`
2. Search for open pull requests in repository npi/npi: `is:pr is:open repo:npi/npi`

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

query.description:
Search query to search for GitHub repositories. Below are some query examples:
1. Search for all repositories that contain "test" and use Python: `test language:python`
2. Search for repositories with more than 1000 stars: `stars:>1000`

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}

functions.description: Subscribe to notifications (a.k.a. watch) for activity in a repository on GitHub.
functions.name: watch

repo.description: Name of the repository in format {owner}/{repo}
